docs.snippet: Police released a composite sketch on Thursday of a toddler whose body parts were found over the weekend in a Chicago park, as investigators continued to scour the area and search for leads....
docs.lead_paragraph: Police released a composite sketch on Thursday of a toddler whose body parts were found over the weekend in a Chicago park, as investigators continued to scour the area and search for leads.

headline.main: Police Give Sketch of Child After Body Parts Found in Chicago Park
headline.print_headline: Police Give Sketch of Child After Body Parts Found in Chicago Park

docs.snippet: Company executives may be quicker to hire lawyers and less likely to cooperate with investigations because of a renewed push by U.S. prosecutors to put individuals in prison instead of only levying big fines on corporations that break the law, law...
docs.lead_paragraph: Company executives may be quicker to hire lawyers and less likely to cooperate with investigations because of a renewed push by U.S. prosecutors to put individuals in prison instead of only levying big fines on corporations that break the law, lawyers with expertise in white-collar crime cases said.

headline.main: New U.S. Prosecution Policy Is Recipe for Corporate Conflict: Lawyers
headline.print_headline: New U.S. Prosecution Policy Is Recipe for Corporate Conflict: Lawyers

docs.snippet: Chastised in the 2011 election, the governing People’s Action Party will find out on Friday whether steps taken since to make amends have been enough....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chastised in the 2011 election, the governing People’s Action Party will find out on Friday whether steps taken since to make amends have been enough.
docs.abstract: Singapore's coming parliamentary vote, its first general election since 2011, is generating a lot of suspense over how many of contested 89 seats the ruling People's Action Party may win; long-governing party has struggled to make amends with voters after recent signs of discontent.

headline.main: Singapore Vote Will Test Long Ruling Party’s Grip on Power
headline.print_headline: Suspense in Singapore Vote Is the Strength of a Long-Governing Party’s Grip

docs.snippet: An independent inquiry contradicting the official account has renewed parents’ hopes and has brought new cynicism into the public’s perceptions of its leaders....
docs.lead_paragraph: An independent inquiry contradicting the official account has renewed parents’ hopes and has brought new cynicism into the public’s perceptions of its leaders.
docs.abstract: International report challenging Mexican government's formal explanation of 2014 disappearance of 43 student teachers in town of Ayotzinapa has fostered both hope and cynicism in citizens and engendered calls for government to respond; officials have been accused of ignoring country's security issues in favor of spin campaign focused on economic growth, and apparent willingness of some within Pres Enrique Pena Nieto's office to admit failings marks significant attitude shift.

headline.main: Report Renews Hope and Doubt on Missing Students in Mexico
headline.print_headline: Report Renews Hope and Doubt on Missing Students in Mexico
